input_text:
Job Title: Paraplanner

Location: Frisco, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Paraplanner -Top Workplace/Award-Winning Culture/Great Benefits

Are you passionate about serving others?

Are you seeking a high-performance environment - one that is mission-driven, supportive, and full of opportunity?

Then look no further!

As a SageSpring Wealth Partners Paraplanner, you'll assist Advisors in determining a variety of opportunities to educate clients and help them achieve and exceed their financial goals. This position will require extensive research and analysis of client data, utilizing planning software and various other tools to provide a clear and concise financial plan. The successful Paraplanner will be analytical, have an attention to detail, and have a nose for problem-solving.

Key Functions Of The Paraplanner

Prepare letters, forms, and spreadsheets to assist with servicing existing clients and prospecting for new clients.Prepare investment reports, deliverables, and client agendas for meetings with clientsEnter and receive orders for the Financial Advisor.Ensure required client paperwork is current with firm and industry requirements, rules and regulations.Be responsible for meeting follow up process and implementing proposed recommendationsMaintain databases and create reports using portfolio software programs.Systematically review households for planning opportunities & enhancementsGather client information for analysis and incorporation into ongoing financial planning processAnswer advanced client inquiries via phone, email, and in-person related to ongoing financial managementAssists Financial Advisor with marketing efforts for seminars and compliance approval for advertising literature.Receives cross-training and assists with other operational functions as required.


Qualifications

Bachelors’ degree in finance, accounting, business or related field3+ years of prior industry experience as a registered associate in sales and supportCurrent Series 65 holder and/or professional CFP designation


Rewards:

Great Benefits – Includes Health Insurance, Dental, Vision, 401K, Life Insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability, Paid Vacation and Holidays.Top Workplace – Join a vibrant workplace culture recognized as a Top Workplace* in USA TODAY and The Tennessean for the last four years.Inspiring Leadership – Our leadership truly embodies the definition of servant leaders, inspiring a work environment in which our teams can flourish that’s energetic, positive, fun, and highly supportive.Team Engagement – You will build some genuinely special relationships and bonds throughout our team and partners.High Performance - Our motto is “Humble. Hungry. Smart.” and that’s truly exemplified from the top down.Continuing Education - Let us help you transform your career goals and educational accomplishments into opportunities and successes.Community Involvement – We’re passionate about supporting our community with each office choosing a charity/cause to champion.


About Us

Recognized as a Top Workplace* for the last four consecutive years, SageSpring Wealth Partners operates as a family. With more than 40 wealth teams covering five states, our client-focused approach continues to help drive our growth across the country. We build our relationships through trust and with the heart of a teacher. We partner with clients in pursuit of financial independence and planning for the future. Through our broker-dealer Raymond James, we have the support of a large company, while offering clients the intimate service of a small firm.

Job Type: Full-time/On-Site

Work Location: Frisco, TX

Schedule: Monday through Friday, Days

Top Workplaces Award (2023)


More than 1,000 companies were invited to participate, 106 were recognized as one of the Tennessean Top Places to work. The Tennessean welcomed anyone to nominate an organization and partnered with Energage, who also reached out to companies. Any employer was eligible, as long as it had at least 35 employees in Middle Tennessee. Employees could be public, private, nonprofit or governmental. Once employers were nominated, employees were asked to fill out an online questionnaire that gave more information about the companies they worked for. Information gathered included issues relating to workplace culture, including Alignment, Connection, Effectiveness, Engagement, Leadership, and the Basics, including pay, benefits, flexibility, training, and expectations. Employers were then ranked among groups of similar size to most accurately compare results, with those that scored high being recognized. The ranking may not be representative of any one client's experience, is not an endorsement, and is not indicative of advisor's future performance. Neither Raymond James nor any of its Financial Advisors or RIA firms pay a fee in exchange for this award/rating. Neither Energage nor the Tennessean are affiliated with Raymond James.

Over 42,000 companies participated and roughly 1,300 were recognized as one of Top USA Workplaces. The publisher welcomed employees to nominate an organization through a survey partnered with Energage. To be eligible, employers must have at least 150 employees and could be public, private, nonprofit, for profit, or governmental. Once employers were nominated, employees were asked to fill out an online questionnaire that gave more information about the companies they worked for. Information gathered included issues relating to workplace culture, including Alignment, Connection, Effectiveness, Engagement, Leadership, and the Basics, including pay, benefits, flexibility, training, and expectations. Employers were then ranked among groups of similar size to most accurately compare results, with those that scored high being recognized. This ranking is based upon the period from 11/27/2021 to 11/27/2022, and was published in January 2023. The ranking may not be representative of any one client's experience, is not an endorsement, and is not indicative of an advisor’s future performance. This ranking is not based on the services/advice offered by our financial advisors. Neither Raymond James nor any of its Financial Advisors or RIA firms pay a fee in exchange for this award/rating. Neither Energage nor Top Workplaces is affiliated with Raymond James.

Experience Level (if available): None

Prepare investment reports and deliverables for client meetings
Enter and receive orders for the Financial Advisor
Maintain databases and create reports using portfolio software
Systematically review households for planning opportunities
Receive cross-training and assist with other operational functions
output_json.company_information: SageSpring Wealth Partners is a family-operated business with over 40 wealth teams covering five states. They focus on client relationships, trust, and education to help clients achieve financial independence.
